Practitioner.definition: The physician or operator (often the radiology technician)  who performed the series. The performer is recorded at the series level, since each series in a study may be performed by a different practitioner, at different times, and using different devices. A series may be performed by multiple practitioners.

PlanDefinition.name: definition
PlanDefinition.definition: Identifies the protocol, questionnaire, guideline or other specification the care plan should be conducted in accordance with.

PlanDefinition.name: definition
PlanDefinition.definition: Identifies the protocol, questionnaire, guideline or other specification the planned activity should be conducted in accordance with.

PlanDefinition.name: definition
PlanDefinition.definition: Protocol or definition followed by this request.

PlanDefinition.name: definition
PlanDefinition.definition: Protocol or definition followed by this request.

Questionnaire.definition: Identifies the protocol, questionnaire, guideline or other specification the care plan should be conducted in accordance with.

Questionnaire.name: definition
Questionnaire.definition: Identifies the protocol, questionnaire, guideline or other specification the planned activity should be conducted in accordance with.

CarePlan.name: basedOn
CarePlan.definition: A care plan that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this care plan.

CarePlan.name: replaces
CarePlan.definition: Completed or terminated care plan whose function is taken by this new care plan.

CarePlan.name: partOf
CarePlan.definition: A larger care plan of which this particular care plan is a component or step.

CarePlan.name: basedOn
CarePlan.definition: Details concerning a test or procedure requested.

CarePlan.name: basedOn
CarePlan.definition: A list of the diagnostic requests that resulted in this imaging study being performed.

CarePlan.name: basedOn
CarePlan.definition: A plan or request that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this medication request.

CarePlan.name: basedOn
CarePlan.definition: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.

Group.name: subject
Group.definition: Identifies the patient or group whose intended care is described by the plan.

Group.name: subject
Group.definition: Indicates the patient or group who the condition record is associated with.

Group.name: subject
Group.definition: The subject of the report. Usually, but not always, this is a patient. However diagnostic services also perform analyses on specimens collected from a variety of other sources.

Group.name: subject
Group.definition: The patient ro group present at the encounter.

Group.name: subject

Group.name: subject

Comments: Indirect characteristics may be those of a specimen, fetus, donor,  other observer (for example a relative or EMT), or any observation made about the subject.

Group.name: subject
Group.definition: On whom or what the procedure or diagnostic is to be performed. This is usually a human patient, but can also be requested on animals, groups of humans or animals, devices such as dialysis machines, or even locations (typically for environmental scans).

Encounter.name: context
Encounter.definition: Identifies the original context in which this particular CarePlan was created.

Encounter.name: encounter
Encounter.definition: A billed item may include goods or services provided in multiple encounters.

Encounter.name: context
Encounter.definition: Encounter during which the condition was first asserted.

Encounter.name: context
Encounter.definition: The healthcare event  (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) which this DiagnosticReport per is about.

Encounter.name: partOf
Encounter.definition: Another Encounter of which this encounter is a part of (administratively or in time).

Encounter.name: encounter
Encounter.definition: A billed item may include goods or services provided in multiple encounters.

Encounter.name: context
Encounter.definition: The encounter or episode at which the request is initiated.

Encounter.name: encounter
Encounter.definition: The visit or admission or other contact between patient and health care provider the immunization was performed as part of.

Encounter.name: context
Encounter.definition: A link to an encounter, or episode of care, that identifies the particular occurrence or set occurrences of contact between patient and health care provider.

Encounter.name: context
Encounter.definition: The healthcare event  (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) during which this observation is made.

Encounter.name: context
Encounter.definition: An encounter or episode of care that provides additional information about the healthcare context in which this request is made.

EpisodeOfCare.name: context
EpisodeOfCare.definition: Identifies the original context in which this particular CarePlan was created.

EpisodeOfCare.name: context
EpisodeOfCare.definition: Encounter during which the condition was first asserted.

EpisodeOfCare.name: context
EpisodeOfCare.definition: The healthcare event  (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) which this DiagnosticReport per is about.

EpisodeOfCare.name: episodeOfCare
EpisodeOfCare.definition: Where a specific encounter should be classified as a part of a specific episode(s) of care this field should be used. This association can facilitate grouping of related encounters together for a specific purpose, such as government reporting, issue tracking, association via a common problem.  The association is recorded on the encounter as these are typically created after the episode of care, and grouped on entry rather than editing the episode of care to append another encounter to it (the episode of care could span years).

EpisodeOfCare.name: context
EpisodeOfCare.definition: The encounter or episode at which the request is initiated.

EpisodeOfCare.name: context
EpisodeOfCare.definition: A link to an encounter, or episode of care, that identifies the particular occurrence or set occurrences of contact between patient and health care provider.

EpisodeOfCare.name: context
EpisodeOfCare.definition: The healthcare event  (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) during which this observation is made.

EpisodeOfCare.name: context
EpisodeOfCare.definition: An encounter or episode of care that provides additional information about the healthcare context in which this request is made.

CareTeam.name: author
CareTeam.definition: Identifies the individual(s) or ogranization who is responsible for the content of the care plan.

CareTeam.name: careTeam
CareTeam.definition: Identifies all people and organizations who are expected to be involved in the care envisioned by this plan.

CareTeam.name: performer
CareTeam.definition: Identifies who's expected to be involved in the activity.

Condition.name: addresses
Condition.definition: Identifies the conditions/problems/concerns/diagnoses/etc. whose management and/or mitigation are handled by this plan.

Condition.name: reasonReference
Condition.definition: Provides the health condition(s) that drove the inclusion of this particular activity as part of the plan.

Condition.name: condition
Condition.definition: Reason the encounter takes place, as specified using information from another resource. For admissions, this is the admission diagnosis. The indication will typically be a Condition (with other resources referenced in the evidence.detail), or a Procedure.

Condition.name: reasonReference
Condition.definition: Condition or observation that supports why the medication was ordered.

Condition.name: reasonReference
Condition.definition: Indicates another resource that provides a justification for why this diagnostic investigation is being requested.   May relate to the resources referred to in supportingInformation.

Resource.name: supportingInfo
Resource.definition: Identifies portions of the patient's record that specifically influenced the formation of the plan.  These might include co-morbidities, recent procedures, limitations, recent assessments, etc.

Resource.name: outcomeReference
Resource.definition: Details of the outcome or action resulting from the activity.  The reference to an "event" resource, such as Procedure or Encounter or Observation, is the result/outcome of the activity itself.  The activity can be conveyed using CarePlan.activity.detail OR using the CarePlan.activity.reference (a reference to a request resource).

Resource.name: valueReference
Resource.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

Resource.name: detail
Resource.definition: Links to other relevant information, including pathology reports.

Resource.name: valueReference
Resource.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

Resource.name: supportingInformation
Resource.definition: Include additional information (for example, patient height and weight) that supports the ordering of the medication.

Resource.name: replaces
Resource.definition: The request takes the place of the referenced completed or terminated request(s).

Resource.name: supportingInfo
Resource.definition: Additional clinical information about the patient or specimen that may influence the procedure or diagnostics or their interpretations.     This information includes diagnosis, clinical findings and other observations.  In laboratory ordering these are typically referred to as "ask at order entry questions (AOEs)".  This includes observations explicitly requested by the producer (filler) to provide context or supporting information needed to complete the order. For example,  reporting the amount of inspired oxygen for blood gas measurements.

Goal.name: goal
Goal.definition: Describes the intended objective(s) of carrying out the care plan.

Goal.name: goal
Goal.definition: Internal reference that identifies the goals that this activity is intended to contribute towards meeting.

Appointment.name: reference
Appointment.definition: The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource.

Appointment.name: appointment
Appointment.definition: The appointment that scheduled this encounter.

CommunicationRequest.name: reference
CommunicationRequest.definition: The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource.

DeviceRequest.name: reference
DeviceRequest.definition: The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource.

DeviceRequest.name: basedOn
DeviceRequest.definition: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.

MedicationRequest.name: reference
MedicationRequest.definition: The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource.

MedicationRequest.name: prescription
MedicationRequest.definition: Prescription to support the dispensing of Pharmacy or Vision products.

MedicationRequest.name: originalPrescription
MedicationRequest.definition: Original prescription which has been superceded by this prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy services, medications or products. For example, a physician may prescribe a medication which the pharmacy determines is contraindicated, or for which the patient has an intolerance, and therefor issues a new precription for an alternate medication which has the same theraputic intent. The prescription from the pharmacy becomes the 'prescription' and that from the physician becomes the 'original prescription'.

MedicationRequest.name: basedOn
MedicationRequest.definition: Details concerning a test or procedure requested.

MedicationRequest.name: prescription
MedicationRequest.definition: Prescription to support the dispensing of Pharmacy or Vision products.

MedicationRequest.name: originalPrescription
MedicationRequest.definition: Original prescription which has been superceded by this prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy services, medications or products. For example, a physician may prescribe a medication which the pharmacy determines is contraindicated, or for which the patient has an intolerance, and therefor issues a new precription for an alternate medication which has the same theraputic intent. The prescription from the pharmacy becomes the 'prescription' and that from the physician becomes the 'original prescription'.

MedicationRequest.name: basedOn
MedicationRequest.definition: A plan or request that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this medication request.

MedicationRequest.name: priorPrescription
MedicationRequest.definition: A link to a resource representing an earlier order related order or prescription.

MedicationRequest.name: basedOn
MedicationRequest.definition: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.

Medication.definition: Identifies the food, drug or other product to be consumed or supplied in the activity.

Medication.name: medicationReference
Medication.definition: Identifies the medication being requested. This is a link to a resource that represents the medication which may be the details of the medication or simply an attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.

Substance.name: productReference
Substance.definition: Identifies the food, drug or other product to be consumed or supplied in the activity.

Claim.name: claim
Claim.definition: Other claims which are related to this claim such as prior claim versions or for related services.

Claim.name: claim
Claim.definition: The business identifier for the instance: invoice number, claim number, pre-determination or pre-authorization number.

Claim.name: claim
Claim.definition: Other claims which are related to this claim such as prior claim versions or for related services.

Procedure.name: condition
Procedure.definition: Reason the encounter takes place, as specified using information from another resource. For admissions, this is the admission diagnosis. The indication will typically be a Condition (with other resources referenced in the evidence.detail), or a Procedure.

Procedure.name: procedureReference
Procedure.definition: A reference to the performed Procedure.

Coverage.name: coverage
Coverage.definition: Reference to the program or plan identification, underwriter or payor.

Coverage.name: coverage
Coverage.definition: Reference to the program or plan identification, underwriter or payor.

ClaimResponse.name: claimResponse
ClaimResponse.definition: The business identifier for the instance: invoice number, claim number, pre-determination or pre-authorization number.

Device.name: udi
Device.definition: List of Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

Device.name: udi
Device.definition: List of Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

Device.name: udi
Device.definition: List of Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

Device.name: subject
Device.definition: The subject of the report. Usually, but not always, this is a patient. However diagnostic services also perform analyses on specimens collected from a variety of other sources.

Device.name: udi
Device.definition: List of Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

Device.name: udi
Device.definition: List of Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

Device.name: udi
Device.definition: List of Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

Device.name: agent
Device.definition: The healthcare professional responsible for authorizing the initial prescription.

Device.name: subject
Device.definition: The patient, or group of patients, location, or device whose characteristics (direct or indirect) are described by the observation and into whose record the observation is placed.  Comments: Indirect characteristics may be those of a specimen, fetus, donor,  other observer (for example a relative or EMT), or any observation made about the subject.

Device.name: device
Device.definition: The device used to generate the observation data.

Device.name: subject
Device.definition: On whom or what the procedure or diagnostic is to be performed. This is usually a human patient, but can also be requested on animals, groups of humans or animals, devices such as dialysis machines, or even locations (typically for environmental scans).

Device.name: agent
Device.definition: The device, practitioner or organization who initiated the request.

Device.name: performer
Device.definition: The desired perfomer for doing the diagnostic testing.  For example, the surgeon, dermatopathologist, endoscopist, etc.

ClinicalImpression.name: assessment
ClinicalImpression.definition: Reference to a formal record of the evidence on which the staging assessment is based.

DiagnosticReport.name: assessment
DiagnosticReport.definition: Reference to a formal record of the evidence on which the staging assessment is based.

Observation.name: assessment
Observation.definition: Reference to a formal record of the evidence on which the staging assessment is based.

Observation.name: result
Observation.definition: Observations that are part of this diagnostic report. Observations can be simple name/value pairs (e.g. "atomic" results), or they can be grouping observations that include references to other members of the group (e.g. "panels").

Observation.name: reasonReference
Observation.definition: Condition or observation that supports why the medication was ordered.

Observation.name: target
Observation.definition: A reference to the observation or [QuestionnaireResponse](questionnaireresponse.html#) resource that is related to this observation.

Observation.name: reasonReference
Observation.definition: Indicates another resource that provides a justification for why this diagnostic investigation is being requested.   May relate to the resources referred to in supportingInformation.

Contract.name: contract
Contract.definition: The policy(s) which constitute this insurance coverage.

ImmunizationRecommendation.name: basedOn
ImmunizationRecommendation.definition: Details concerning a test or procedure requested.

ImmunizationRecommendation.name: basedOn
ImmunizationRecommendation.definition: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.

Specimen.name: specimen
Specimen.definition: Details about the specimens on which this diagnostic report is based.

Specimen.name: specimen
Specimen.definition: The specimen that was used when this observation was made.

Specimen.name: specimen
Specimen.definition: One or more specimens that the laboratory procedure will use.

ImagingStudy.name: imagingStudy
ImagingStudy.definition: One or more links to full details of any imaging performed during the diagnostic investigation. Typically, this is imaging performed by DICOM enabled modalities, but this is not required. A fully enabled PACS viewer can use this information to provide views of the source images.

ImagingManifest.name: imagingStudy
ImagingManifest.definition: One or more links to full details of any imaging performed during the diagnostic investigation. Typically, this is imaging performed by DICOM enabled modalities, but this is not required. A fully enabled PACS viewer can use this information to provide views of the source images.

Account.name: account
Account.definition: The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this Encounter.

Endpoint.name: endpoint
Endpoint.definition: The network service providing access (e.g., query, view, or retrieval) for the study. See implementation notes for information about using DICOM endpoints. A study-level endpoint applies to each series in the study, unless overridden by a series-level endpoint with the same Endpoint.type.

Endpoint.name: endpoint
Endpoint.definition: The network service providing access (e.g., query, view, or retrieval) for this series. See implementation notes for information about using DICOM endpoints. A series-level endpoint, if present, has precedence over a study-level endpoint with the same Endpoint.type.

DetectedIssue.name: detectedIssue
DetectedIssue.definition: Indicates an actual or potential clinical issue with or between one or more active or proposed clinical actions for a patient; e.g. Drug-drug interaction, duplicate therapy, dosage alert etc.

Provenance.name: eventHistory
Provenance.definition: Links to Provenance records for past versions of this resource or fulfilling request or event resources that identify key state transitions or updates that are likely to be relevant to a user looking at the current version of the resource.

Provenance.name: relevantHistory
Provenance.definition: Key events in the history of the request.

DeviceMetric.name: device
DeviceMetric.definition: The device used to generate the observation data.

QuestionnaireResponse.name: target
QuestionnaireResponse.definition: A reference to the observation or [QuestionnaireResponse](questionnaireresponse.html#) resource that is related to this observation.

Sequence.name: target
Sequence.definition: A reference to the observation or [QuestionnaireResponse](questionnaireresponse.html#) resource that is related to this observation.

HealthcareService.name: performer
HealthcareService.definition: The desired perfomer for doing the diagnostic testing.  For example, the surgeon, dermatopathologist, endoscopist, etc.
